page.title: 11CANNON COURT FARM STABLES.
page.content: My name is Sascha Edwards. My friend Tiffany and I enjoy riding, we have our own ponies, and we stable them at Cannon Court Farm. It is a small farm with only 40 acres, and is situated to the north-west of Maidenhead. The farm has three paddocks, two of them are for the horses, and the other one is a jumping paddock. The jumps are set out all through the summer for us to practise on. When we go out riding there are lots of bridle paths around the farm that we can use. We can also ride on Cookham Dean Common. The owner, Mr. Lovejoy, also grows and sells potatoes, and hay for the horses. Cannon Court Farm is not a riding stables. The horses that are kept there are owned by local people, we have to pay for the stabling and use of the fields, and we have to look after the ponies ourselves.
